text: Vera Jacobsson (born c. 1900s) was a Swedish track and field athlete and a pioneer in women’s athletics in Sweden. She was specialized in the standing long jump and sprint events. She represented Sweden internationally. ==Biography== Jacobsson represented Sweden at the 1926 Women's World Games in Gothenburg. With a distance of 2.28 metres she finished sixth in the standing long jump event.Svenska dagbladets Årsbok 1926 Runeberg.org Together with Sylvia Stave, Asta Plathino and Märta Johansson she competed in the 4 × 110 yards relay event and finished in fourth place. She also competed in the 100 yards event and 250 metres event but didn’t qualify for the final. Jacobsson's participation at Women's World Games was sponsored by women’s magazine Idun.Damerna i Olympisk lek,Idun (Årg. 39, 1926:36, sida 887 (Göteborgs universitetsbibliotek) (läst 25 maj 2022) ==References== Category:1900s births Category:Swedish athletes Category:Long jumpers Category:Sprinters
title: Vera Jacobsson
